Hey everyone! Glad this slack channel exists. Question for anyone that can help..

Right now CRM cards cannot be added to HubSpot Custom Objects and as far as I know this is the only way to add a “button” that can call an api. I need to allow users to take action via on custom objects, does anyone have a workaround or alternative solution? Please and thank you in advance! If I come up with something I will post here.

Background color/wrapper changes have to be supported by your theme at template level ( <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/templates#email> )
If you have no idea what I mean then I would suggest trying the <#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs> channel to hire someone to take a look

Hi, I am getting an error when trying to connect to the HubSpot api via the php client. However, I am getting the error "HubSpot\Factory" can not be found. Here is my code

`use HubSpot\Factory;`
`use HubSpot\Client\Crm\Contacts\ApiException;`

`$hubSpot = Factory::createWithApiKey('apikey');`

`$response = $hubSpot->crm()->contacts()->basicApi()->getPage();`

What am I doing wrong here? I have followed the installation instructions from the GitHub Repo here: <https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-api-php>

But am having the most difficult time. Any help is appreciated.

Hi everyone, I have a question regarding custom form behavior.
I would like to create either a HubSpot or non-HubSpot form, but I do not want to save any form information (for HIPAA compliance). On the form's submission, I want to send the form data to an external API, and when that response comes in I would like to navigate to the next page after the form. It'll be on a landing page or webpage. Does anyone have insight into how to do this or if it's possible?

Hey Connor, HubSpot forms will always deliver the data back to the CRM, so those are probably not a good fit for this use-case. Instead, you'll likely want to use a third-party or completely custom HTML form to handle the user input, send the data to your API (and any necessary data manipulation as well to ensure the API accepts the data) and then either use AJAX or a timeout function to direct the user to the next page.
How do i get the stagename for deals when using crm_associations? or crm_objects?

Hey guys, I have a rather unusual query, we’re in the middle of building a new multi-regional website for a client, they are currently using business units but for various reasons are now finding that they are not getting what they require from business units and are now looking at purchasing a brand new second HubSpot instance. So what I’m trying to find out information on is what ability is there to migrate over CMS data. Is it possible to migrate over specific data - ie existing populated website pages and landing pages etc or an we clone an entire instance like-for-like and remove what we don’t want. Since we’re in the middle the new build we really need some answers before we go too far down one path and could potentially need to re-do everything. Would really appreciate some insight if anyone has experienced anything similar. Thanks
